Name: Jonathan Lyle
Job/Team Function: With direct line responsibility for key members of the Executive team, the CE role leads Dstl as a Trading Fund, delivering value for money science and technology-based support and advice to customers.  This includes getting the best out of suppliers and partners, and balancing short-term delivery with long-term capability.  The CE role is ultimately responsible for ensuring: the financial viability of Dstl; that customers are satisfied; and that the Dstl workforce is suitably engaged and rewarded for their contributions.

Name: Graham Balmer
Job/Team Function: This role is a key member of the Executive and ensures that Dstl can successfully deliver its operational programme through the effective and efficient support of the core infrastructure and enabling services for Dstl including Estates, Security, SHEF, Resilience, Business Administration Services, Knowledge and Information Services and Commercial Services.

Name: Richard Brooks
Job/Team Function: This role works with all the key senior internal and external stakeholders to define the requirements and formulate and deliver the MoD’s Science and Technology (S&T) Research portfolio for the Chief Scientific Adviser (CSA).

Name: Christine Hewitt
Job/Team Function: Responsible for the development and implementation of People Strategy, including organisational culture and behaviours, which sets out the people focused aspects of the Dstl corporate plan identifying how Dstl staff are resourced, managed, developed and rewarded to enable business success.  Also responsible for relationships with Trade Unions and wider Civil Service Human Resources.

Name: Mark Alexander
Job/Team Function: This role is a key member of the Dstl Executive Team and Main Board (and audit committee?) and is accountable for the robust and rigorous financial control, performance and financial management of DSTL. The role also provides high level strategic financial advice to drive the business forward and ensure the business makes the right decisions.

Name: Peter Thompson
Job/Team Function: The Director of Corporate Strategy and Deputy Chief Executive role is a key member of the Executive team. This role sets the direction for the organisation, managing the regular business strategy planning calendar, providing strategic insights and analysis and other business input in to key strategic decisions, ensuring that Dstl is governed properly and following necessary legislation, regulation and procedures, and ensuring appropriate communications with external and internal audiences.
